channel.title: Posts on Dwayne McDaniel's Personal Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Dwayne McDaniel's Personal Blog

item.title: Nextjs Conf 2020
item.description: The NextJS Conference 2020: 70K registered and saw so many people on Discord A new blog for a new leg of my journey I am super excited to write my first personal blog post about my experiences at a conference in my new industry: the first ever NextJS Conference! This was by far the largest virtual event I have taken part in and it was super well organized and flowed really well.

item.title: Why I Build Dumb Things
item.description: I like building dumb ideas out. Here are a few of my favorites: CSSCMS - A static site generator based on stuffing everything we can into CSS. Clean and Soap Bar - A strange little joke on a website lending legitimacy to a company. Am I Online Or Not Dot Info - The most primitive example I could build of a microservice. KevinThull.com - A glorious inside joke in the Drupal community to build a GithubPage Kevin Thull himself can not open pull requests for.

item.title: Old Friends Are the Best
item.description: As I was on my way to PressNomics I was waylaid by the airline industry mismanagement of things and got stranded overnight in Denver. One of the best benefits of being as old as I am though is that I have made a lot of friends and acquaintances over the years pretty much all over the country and certain parts of the world. So, I thought “who do I know in Denver who might let me crash with them?

item.title: Welcome to my new blog
item.description: You might be wondering why I built this site. And if you know me, you might be wondering why I am starting yet another blog. I hope to answer those fully in this first post and there are basically 2 main reasons. 1. I wanted to build a new site based on a static site generator I have been fascinated by JAMStack for a long while now. There is fundamental question about “do we need a DB for most use cases anymore?
